pages.text:
THE TEAM
OUR TEAM
Our team is comprised of a professional staff and a volunteer board of directors with a diversity of experience in the arts, non-profit and business world. Highly motivated by the desire to showcase the highest caliber of arts and entertainment, our team produces a festival especially designed for our visitors and collectors.

GETTING HERE
FESTIVAL LOCATION & HOURS
Festival Address
: 2700 S. Bayshore Drive, Miami, FL 33133.
The Festival is located just south of downtown Miami, adjacent to beautiful Biscayne Bay. It runs along the streets of McFarlane Road, South Bayshore Drive and Pan American Drive.
Festival Hours
:
Saturday, February 14: 10 AM - 6 PM
Sunday, February 15: 10 AM - 6 PM
Monday, February 16: 10 AM - 5 PM
DRIVING DIRECTIONS
When driving to the festival please be aware of the traffic on I-95 SB at Exit 1A, Rickenbacker Causeway. If you chose to travel I-95 SB please make sure to follow US1 to 27th Avenue. We recommend taking 836 West and then 27th Avenue south to the festival. When driving, please take advantage of the 511 Traveler Information Service. Call 511 and get all your traffic updates.
TRANSIT
Looking for a convenient way to get to the
Coconut Grove Arts Festival
? Consider riding with a ride share service for a hassle-free journey! Simply open your preferred ride share app, enter your destination as “Coconut Grove Arts Festival,” and your driver will take you right to the heart of the action
PARKING TIPS
There is plenty of parking available in Coconut Grove to accommodate visitors to the Coconut Grove Arts Festival. Options include parking garages, on-street parking meters and private parking lots.
EVENT RULES
PETS POLICY
Be kind to your pets and leave them at home when you visit the Arts Festival.
NO Animals of any kind. *
Exception: Services animal with proper vest for Identification
ALCOHOL POLICY
Alcoholic beverages purchased at the event remain on-site. Festival security will ask you to dispose of any alcoholic beverages before you exit. Please do not bring outside beverages into the Arts Festival. For safety reasons, cans and glass bottles are prohibited within the site.
PROHIBITED ITEMS
Weapons of any kind are not permitted. Skateboards, roller blades, bicycles, scooters, large signs and placards which may endanger or inconvenience the public attending the Festival are prohibited. Festival organizers reserve the right to decline admittance to anyone who violates the reasonable policies established for public safety or to restrict activities such as public address to designated areas.
For more information, visit our
FAQ
PHOTO POLICY
Photo Policy – While cameras are permitted into the Festival, patrons are not allowed to take photos of the artists’ work at their individual booth areas. Many participating artists will have signs reminding patrons of this policy.
ADA & ACCESSIBILITY
If you need assistance for accessibility in order to participate in one of our events, please contact us 72 hours in advance. You can reach by phone at (305) 447-0401 or by email at
info@cgaf.com
.

Emerging Artists
EMERGING ARTISTS
Next Generation Program
The Coconut Grove Arts Festival’s Emerging Artists Program is a robust mentoring program designed to help create the Next Generation of Art Show Artists. Our goal is to give this next generation of Artists the foundation they need to begin their art show careers after completing the second year.
This will be a two-year program.
The first year is Education and Internship
Participate in free workshops including financial planning, portfolio reviews, art show booth displays, and pricing work.
Intern during the festival. This is to learn the business firsthand. The intern will help with all artists’ aspects of the festival and spend time with professional mentors.
In the second year, this next generation of artists will have the opportunity to show their work:
Highlights of this year include:
Tent in our Emerging Artist section
Personal financial planning
Personal application consultation.
Requirements:
Resides in Miami-Dade County.
If not a local resident, must be willing to travel to Miami and provide their own housing during the festival.
Has not participated in a major juried art festival.
Must be 18 or older to participate in this program.
College or University is not required.
2025 APPLICATIONS ARE NOW OPEN!
CLICK HERE TO APPLY
